<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 120, 636, 145]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge International AS & A Level  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 170, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 214, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 240, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
February/March 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 392, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 485, 574]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 605]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 856, 636]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 636, 777, 652]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m} \text{s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 213, 695]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 697, 384, 712]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 712, 728, 728]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 87, 868, 255]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 275, 920, 345]]<|/det|>
The displacement of a particle at time \(t\) s after leaving a fixed point \(O\) is \(s \mathrm{m}\). The diagram shows a displacement-time graph which models the motion of the particle. The graph consists of 4 straight line segments. The particle travels \(50\mathrm{m}\) in the first \(10\mathrm{s}\), then travels at \(2\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) for a period of \(10\mathrm{s}\). The particle then comes to rest for a period of \(20\mathrm{s}\), before returning to its starting point when \(t = 60\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 357, 144, 376]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 357, 662, 377]]<|/det|>
Find the velocity of the particle during the last 20 s of its motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 357, 920, 376]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 574, 144, 592]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 574, 781, 593]]<|/det|>
Sketch a velocity-time graph for the motion of the particle from \(t = 0\) to \(t = 60\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 574, 920, 593]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A crate of mass \(600\mathrm{kg}\) is being pulled up a line of greatest slope of a rough plane at a constant speed of \(2\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) by a rope attached to a winch. The plane is inclined at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) to the horizontal and the rope is parallel to the plane. The winch is working at a constant rate of \(8\mathrm{kW}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 608, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the coefficient of friction between the crate and the plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 917, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[262, 84, 732, 257]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 275, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
Four coplanar forces act at a point. The magnitudes of the forces are \(F\mathrm{N}\), \(2F\mathrm{N}\), \(3F\mathrm{N}\) and \(30\mathrm{N}\). The directions of the forces are as shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 322, 732, 342]]<|/det|>
Given that the forces are in equilibrium, find the value of \(F\) and the value of \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 323, 917, 342]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 96, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
A particle moves in a straight line starting from a point \(O\). The velocity \(v \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) of the particle \(t \mathrm{s}\) after leaving \(O\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[381, 120, 618, 141]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = t^{3} - \frac{9}{2} t^{2} + 1 \text{ for } 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 4.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 152, 920, 190]]<|/det|>
You may assume that the velocity of the particle is positive for \(t < \frac{1}{2}\), is zero at \(t = \frac{1}{2}\) and is negative for \(t > \frac{1}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 199, 146, 217]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 199, 562, 217]]<|/det|>
Find the distance travelled between \(t = 0\) and \(t = \frac{1}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 199, 920, 217]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
Find the positive value of \(t\) at which the acceleration is zero. Hence find the total distance travelled between \(t = 0\) and this instant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
A car of mass \(1800\mathrm{kg}\) is towing a trailer of mass \(300\mathrm{kg}\) up a straight road inclined at an angle \(\alpha\) to the horizontal, where \(\sin \alpha = 0.05\) . The car and trailer are connected by a tow-bar which is light and rigid and is parallel to the road. There is a resistance force of \(800\mathrm{N}\) acting on the car and a resistance force of \(FN\) acting on the trailer. The driving force of the car's engine is \(3000\mathrm{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 149, 146, 166]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 149, 348, 166]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(F = 100\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 640, 198]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration of the car and the tension in the tow-bar.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 920, 198]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
It is given instead that the total work done against \(F\) in moving a distance of \(50 \text{m}\) up the road is \(6000 \text{J}\). The speed of the car at the start of the \(50 \text{m}\) is \(20 \text{m s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 119, 722, 138]]<|/det|>
Use an energy method to find the speed of the car at the end of the \(50 \text{m}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[282, 87, 719, 325]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 338, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows two particles \(P\) and \(Q\) which lie on a line of greatest slope of a plane \(ABC\). Particles \(P\) and \(Q\) are each of mass \(m \mathrm{kg}\). The plane is inclined at an angle \(\theta\) to the horizontal, where \(\sin \theta = 0.6\) . The length of \(AB\) is \(0.75 \mathrm{m}\) and the length of \(BC\) is \(3.25 \mathrm{m}\). The section \(AB\) of the plane is smooth and the section \(BC\) is rough. The coefficient of friction between each particle and the section \(BC\) is \(0.25\) . Particle \(P\) is released from rest at \(A\). At the same instant, particle \(Q\) is released from rest at \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 433, 144, 452]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 432, 739, 452]]<|/det|>
Verify that particle \(P\) reaches \(B\) 0.5 s after it is released, with speed \(3 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 433, 918, 452]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 648, 146, 667]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 648, 855, 667]]<|/det|>
Find the time that it takes from the instant the two particles are released until they collide.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 648, 920, 667]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 275, 920, 308]]<|/det|>
The two particles coalesce when they collide. The coefficient of friction between the combined particle and the plane is still 0.25 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 319, 144, 337]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 319, 920, 352]]<|/det|>
Find the time that it takes from the instant the particles collide until the combined particle reaches \(C\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 364, 915, 380]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 73, 567, 90]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
